	Do have a Bsc in Finance or a related field?

Head of Operations Job at UHR Consult Limited




        
    

        
        UHR Consult Limited - Our client, a Finance company, is recruiting qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	Do have a Bsc in Finance or a related field?
	Do you have a strong network of Investors, Financiers and industry players?
	Do you have advance knowledge of financial modeling, valuations, investment memos and deal structuring?
	Can you manage people?
	Do engage with stakeholders?
	Do you have up to 5years of experience in finance?
	If you do, this opportunity is for you
	Female Candidates only.


Salary
N1,000,000 - N2,000,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only female candidates can apply.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at Tribitat Real Estate
content:
Tribitat Real Estate offers commercial and residential real estate development services to individuals, public and private organisations through the provision of high quality affordable construction management, project management and entitlement processing services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) In-House Counsel

Job Location: Lagos

About the job
     

            
    




	As the in-house counsel with real-estate experience ,you will be crucial in providing legal support for all the business subsidiaries including our real estate and financial operations.
	You will ensure compliance with laws and regulations, review contracts, and advise on legal matters related to real estate transactions, contracts management, financial transactions amongst other business concerns.


Responsibilities


	Contract Management & Documentation: Prepare legal documents for all projects, deeds of assignment, agency and tenancy agreement. Maintain accurate records of legal documents and correspondence.
	Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that all activities comply with local, state, and federal laws (land use). Update all letters and assurance.
	Legal Due Diligence: Carry out due diligence to Identify potential legal risk if any before finalizing an investment or purchase of real estate. Provide guidance and support to clients.
	Dispute Resolution: Liaise with legal consultant on legal matters and assist in the resolution of disputes through negotiation, mediation, or litigation as necessary.
	Review and monitor ownership step plans and ensure that from a legal perspective all necessary pre- and post- close steps are taken.
	Assist Customer service department in preparing letters e.g subscription letters, contract for sales etc.
	Maintain the formal signing authority and contract approval process for the Managing Director and affiliate Directors.
	Provide strategic legal advice to management on all matters.
	Stay abreast of relevant laws and regulations to provide informed advice and recommendations.


Qualifications


	Bachelor of Laws (LL.B.) Degree – Mandatory
	Minimum of 3 years of post-call experience in a law firm or corporate legal department.
	Call to the Nigerian Bar
	Master’s Degree (Optional but Advantageous)
	Proven experience drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts.
	Knowledge of labour law, corporate governance, and regulatory compliance.


Required Skills:


	Corporate & Commercial Law
	Company Secretarial Duties (Board Resolutions, CAC filings)
	Contract Drafting and Negotiation
	Intellectual Property Rights
	Employment & Labour Law
	Taxation & Regulatory Compliance
	Alternative Dispute Resolution
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
	High level of integrity and confidentiality
	Negotiation and persuasion skills
	Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple tasks.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Presenter

Job Location: Lagos

Role Overview


	This is an on-site job and the Presenter will serve as the face and voice of the company during property tours, client engagements, and corporate events.
	This role requires exceptional communication skills, strong presentation abilities, and the capacity to build trust with clients and stakeholders.
	The Presenter will be responsible for delivering clear, engaging, and persuasive presentations about company projects, property offerings, and related services, while ensuring accurate and up-to-date information is communicated.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct guided property tours for clients, investors, and stakeholders, highlighting key features, benefits, and investment potential.
	Prepare and deliver high-quality presentations for project updates, investor briefings, client meetings, and promotional events.
	Represent the company at exhibitions, conferences, open houses, and networking events.
	Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to ensure presentations align with the company’s brand identity and sales strategy.
	Research and stay updated on all current and upcoming projects, property market trends, and industry developments.
	Engage with clients during and after presentations to answer questions, provide clarifications, and offer tailored recommendations.
	Maintain detailed records of client interactions, feedback, and follow-up actions.
	Assist in preparing multimedia content (slides, videos, brochures) to support presentations.
	Ensure all presentation materials are accurate, visually appealing, and delivered on schedule.
	Promote the company’s values and maintain a professional image in all interactions.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Marketing, Real Estate, Business Administration, or related field (preferred).
	Proven experience as a Presenter, Public Speaker, Real Estate Salesperson, or similar client-facing role.
	Close proximity to sangotedo Lekki-epe expressway
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Confident public speaking abilities and strong stage presence.
	Ability to explain technical or detailed property information in a simple, engaging manner.
	Good understanding of the real estate industry and Lagos property market.
	Proficiency in MS Office and presentation tools (PowerPoint, Keynote, Canva).
	Excellent interpersonal skills with a friendly and approachable personality.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Professional appearance and demeanor.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: odietelinda@gmail.com using "Presenter" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Chartered Accountant

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Chartered Accountant to join our finance team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing all financial activities of the company, including preparing accurate financial reports, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements, managing budgets, advising on financial strategy, and providing insightful analysis to support business decisions.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Reporting & Analysis:


	Prepare and present accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and improvement opportunities.
	Provide strategic recommendations to management based on financial analysis.


Budgeting & Forecasting:


	Develop and monitor annual budgets and forecasts.
	Track and report budget performance against actual results.
	Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising quality.


Tax & Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure timely filing of tax returns (VAT, PAYE, WHT, CIT, etc.) and compliance with all regulatory requirements.
	Liaise with tax authorities and external auditors as required.
	Keep up to date with changes in tax laws and accounting standards.


Internal Controls & Risk Management:


	Develop, implement, and monitor effective internal control systems.
	Assess financial risks and propose mitigation measures.
	Safeguard company assets through robust financial processes.


Cash Flow & Treasury Management:


	Manage company cash flow to ensure operational liquidity.
	Oversee accounts receivable and accounts payable functions.
	Maintain strong banking relationships.


Audit & Assurance:


	Coordinate internal and external audits.
	Prepare audit schedules and ensure timely resolution of audit queries.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related fields
	Minimum of 4 years of proven work experience in a similar role, preferably in real estate industry.
	Close proximity to Sangotedo Lekki Lagos State
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) required.
	Strong knowledge of FIRS, LIRS,IRS and tax laws.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g. Sage, QuickBooks, SAP) and MS Excel.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Key Competencies:


	Integrity and professionalism.
	Strategic financial planning.
	Deadline-oriented and results-driven.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: odietelinda@gmail.com using "Application for Chartered Accountant" using the job title as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Control Officer",
  "description": "Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Control Officerto oversee service delivery, facility standards, and customer experience within our Lifestyle Center.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for monitoring quality, ensuring compliance with policies, and driving continuous improvement across all departments.


Key Responsibilities


	Implement and maintain quality control procedures and benchmarks across all service areas.
	Conduct regular inspections of facilities to ensure cleanliness, safety, and maintenance standards are met.
	Monitor staff performance and customer service delivery to ensure compliance with set standards.
	Investigate and resolve quality-related issues in collaboration with relevant departments.
	Collect and analyze customer feedback to identify trends and areas for improvement.
	Prepare and present periodic quality audit reports to management.
	Provide training and support to staff to maintain service excellence.
	Ensure adherence to health, safety, and regulatory requirements.
	Recommend best practices and innovations to enhance customer satisfaction.
	Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, Quality Management, or a related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of experience in quality assurance/control, preferably within hospitality, retail, or lifestyle centers.
	Strong understanding of customer service standards and facility management practices.
	Experience in staff training, compliance monitoring, and service audits is an advantage.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-23",

Quality Control Officer Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Control Officerto oversee service delivery, facility standards, and customer experience within our Lifestyle Center.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for monitoring quality, ensuring compliance with policies, and driving continuous improvement across all departments.


Key Responsibilities


	Implement and maintain quality control procedures and benchmarks across all service areas.
	Conduct regular inspections of facilities to ensure cleanliness, safety, and maintenance standards are met.
	Monitor staff performance and customer service delivery to ensure compliance with set standards.
	Investigate and resolve quality-related issues in collaboration with relevant departments.
	Collect and analyze customer feedback to identify trends and areas for improvement.
	Prepare and present periodic quality audit reports to management.
	Provide training and support to staff to maintain service excellence.
	Ensure adherence to health, safety, and regulatory requirements.
	Recommend best practices and innovations to enhance customer satisfaction.
	Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, Quality Management, or a related field.
	2–4 years of experience in quality assurance/control, preferably within hospitality, retail, or lifestyle centers.
	Strong understanding of customer service standards and facility management practices.
	Experience in staff training, compliance monitoring, and service audits is an advantage.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer&nbsp;(Quantity Surveyor)

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and strategic Procurement Officer&nbsp;with experience in quantity surveying, specializing in Equipment Leasing &amp; Procurement to oversee sourcing, negotiating, and acquiring equipment for operational needs.
	The ideal candidate will manage vendor relationships, ensure cost-effectiveness, and maintain compliance with procurement policies and regulations.


Main Duties and Responsibilities


	Identify and evaluate suppliers for leasing and purchasing equipment in line with company needs.
	Negotiate terms, pricing, and contracts with vendors to ensure favorable agreements.
	Coordinate leasing arrangements, including contract execution, payment schedules, and maintenance terms.
	Manage procurement processes, including purchase orders, requisitions, and supplier evaluation.
	Monitor equipment lease renewals, ensuring timely action to prevent service disruptions.
	Ensure compliance with procurement policies, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.
	Maintain records of purchases, leases, and supplier agreements for audit and reporting purposes.
	Work closely with internal departments to understand equipment requirements and ensure timely delivery.
	Develop cost-saving strategies to optimize procurement efficiency and minimize expenses.
	Stay updated on market trends, pricing, and new suppliers for competitive advantage.
	Assist in maintaining company quality control program
	Leverage technology, safety measures, and information sharing to increase productivity and profitability
	Handle change order requests and forecast upcoming demand
	Manage materials/equipment inventory
	Maintain and build trusted relationships with key customers, clients, partners, and stakeholders
	Positively represent the company at all times through a success-oriented and professional demeanor
	Work with team members to complete duties as needed


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Procurement, or a related field.
	5 years of experience in procurement, leasing, or supply chain management, preferably in equipment leasing.
	Strong negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
	Knowledge of procurement laws, vendor management, and contract negotiation.
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Excellent communication and relationship management abilities.
	Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and work under pressure.


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application

Procurement Officer (Quantity Surveyor) Job at Ultimus Holdings




        
    

        
        Ultimus Holdings is a global investment company with the sole purpose of contributing to the sustainable development of African economies. Our investing deployment is broad-based and long-term. We specifically invest is sectors that demonstrates growth; leveraging our sector expertise in ensuring we become market leaders in all operational portfolios.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer (Quantity Surveyor)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and strategic Procurement Officer with experience in quantity surveying, specializing in Equipment Leasing & Procurement to oversee sourcing, negotiating, and acquiring equipment for operational needs.
	The ideal candidate will manage vendor relationships, ensure cost-effectiveness, and maintain compliance with procurement policies and regulations.


Main Duties and Responsibilities


	Identify and evaluate suppliers for leasing and purchasing equipment in line with company needs.
	Negotiate terms, pricing, and contracts with vendors to ensure favorable agreements.
	Coordinate leasing arrangements, including contract execution, payment schedules, and maintenance terms.
	Manage procurement processes, including purchase orders, requisitions, and supplier evaluation.
	Monitor equipment lease renewals, ensuring timely action to prevent service disruptions.
	Ensure compliance with procurement policies, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.
	Maintain records of purchases, leases, and supplier agreements for audit and reporting purposes.
	Work closely with internal departments to understand equipment requirements and ensure timely delivery.
	Develop cost-saving strategies to optimize procurement efficiency and minimize expenses.
	Stay updated on market trends, pricing, and new suppliers for competitive advantage.
	Assist in maintaining company quality control program
	Leverage technology, safety measures, and information sharing to increase productivity and profitability
	Handle change order requests and forecast upcoming demand
	Manage materials/equipment inventory
	Maintain and build trusted relationships with key customers, clients, partners, and stakeholders
	Positively represent the company at all times through a success-oriented and professional demeanor
	Work with team members to complete duties as needed


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Procurement, or a related field.
	5 years of experience in procurement, leasing, or supply chain management, preferably in equipment leasing.
	Strong negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
	Knowledge of procurement laws, vendor management, and contract negotiation.
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Excellent communication and relationship management abilities.
	Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and work under pressure.


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@ultimusholdings.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
